text: Hi everyone, I am Asavari (pronounced: A-saa-vari), a B2B content marketer based in India. Here's more about me: <https://asavarisharma.com/about/>. I currently head the content division for Think Little Big Marketing, a boutique marketing agency in London. I also freelance extensively as a writer and strategist, helping UK/US businesses in B2B tech & SaaS, accounting, and eCommerce domains. I am very excited to be a part of this community and hope to learn a lot about marketing from you all. Thank you! :)

text: Hi everyone :wave::skin-tone-4:! I'm happy to be now part of this community and excited to dive into so many resources. I'm a screenwriter-turned-marketer :writing_hand::skin-tone-4: based in Berlin, Germany.

text: I'm starting a new job in a few days – I'll be responsible for content marketing at Leapsome, a SaaS platform for employee engagement and performance management. I've mostly worked on B2C, and I'm thrilled to explore the B2B content marketing universe. :female-astronaut::skin-tone-4:

elements.text: I'm starting a new job in a few days – I'll be responsible for content marketing at Leapsome, a SaaS platform for employee engagement and performance management. I've mostly worked on B2C, and I'm thrilled to explore the B2B content marketing universe.

text: Looking forward to lots of learning and to bouncing off ideas with you all. In case any of you ever wants to connect on LinkedIn, you can find me <http://linkedin.com/in/isabela-alzuguir/|here>. Cheers! :raised_hands::skin-tone-4:

text: Hi! How cool! How has screenwriting helped you the most in the marketing world? So intrigued.

elements.text: Hi! How cool! How has screenwriting helped you the most in the marketing world? So intrigued.

text: Hi Laura! Thanks for your message. I would say by irreversibly transforming my mindset into "I see storytelling everywhere and I can't switch this off" and for teaching me the value of a structured narrative framework (for any type of content).

elements.text: Hi Laura! Thanks for your message. I would say by irreversibly transforming my mindset into "I see storytelling everywhere and I can't switch this off" and for teaching me the value of a structured narrative framework (for any type of content).

text: So, that sounds like a super power to me. :sparkles: That's fantastic, thanks for answering. :blush:

elements.text: So, that sounds like a super power to me.

text: Congrats on the new opportunity! My last role was in the HR tech space, and I did some writing about employee engagement. It's a really neat space because you'll be able to relate to what you're writing about!

text: Thanks a lot, Samantha! That's precisely what makes me so excited. It's also really important for me to work in purpose-driven environments. :muscle::skin-tone-4:

text: Thank you! Not everyone values this perspective, but it's what moves me, so... :woman-shrugging::skin-tone-4: I just have to always keep on working with teams that appreciate it.

Hi everyone! I am <https://www.linkedin.com/in/adam-d-stephens/|Adam Stephens>. I am in-house with Pushpay & Church Community Builder. A SaaS company with a heart to help churches & organizations in the faith sector better connect & engage their people and effectively fulfill their mission. I am excited to be a part of this community! Thanks for the welcome. I appreciate all of you contributing!

text: Howdy folks! I'm <@U018DTFJKK2>, a freelance content marketing writer (as well as journalist, essayist & poet) living in York, PA. When I'm not walking my dogs and baking an absurd amount of bread, I write on the environment, finance and digital marketing. I look forward to learning from & contributing to this community!
